content.description: Thin sit start up the middle of the boulder. Very thin.
content.location: From "30 4 year olds" if you walk back towards the hillside for 150' you will come right to this boulder. It is 30' wide and 15' high, red and brown with five lines up it on thin holds. You can see it across the moss from "30 4 year olds".

climbs.name: The Thirty 4 and Seven Center Hang

content.description: A nice warm-up on the The Thirty 4 and Seven boulder. Short and sweet.
content.location: Start a few feet right of The Thirty 4 and Seven year old problems, on the steep face.

climbs.name: The Thirty 4 and Seven Backside Pimp and Crimp

content.description: On the The Thirty 4 and Seven boulder, on northwest side.
content.location: Northwest side of the overhanging feature. Just around the corner, to the right of The Thirty 4 and Seven year Old problems.

content.description: Sit start the center of this nice face into a right hand side pull and a left hand gaston. Big move to slopers. see video
content.location: This boulder is a stone throw east from "30 4 year olds" at the same elevation. It is located in the same cluster of boulders as Bear Rape, Cavitation, The Tombstone etc. myuctv.com/video?id=659

content.description: An interesting stair-like feature on the Step Sister boulder. A nice warm-up! Start SDS in the stair feature and top-out.
content.location: Northeast of 30-4 boulder and nortwest of Cavitation. Approximately 50 feet from both. Distinct stairs on the left side of the east face.

content.description: Another nice line on the Step Sister Boulder. Start just right of the middle, SDS, and move up and left through crimps. Finishes just right of Step Sister.
content.location: Northeast of 30-4 boulder and nortwest of Cavitation. Approximately 50 feet from both. Distinct stairs on the left side of the east face.

content.description: The arete on the north side. sit and go.
content.location: Same boulder as "Backside grind" to the right on the north side where it is 3' feet thick.

content.description: Stand start with good left hand side pull/sloping rail and right hand on prow, go up and then trend left using thee seam and face holds. The prow hold has broke slightly. Easier for tall(6'2" and above) into thin topout. See video and pics.
content.location: This problem is on the backside of the boulder above the "tok cutoff" boulder. It is big and grey. The boulder is northwest of Bear Rape boulder and North of the 30 4 years olds boulder, approximately 150 feet away from both.

content.description: Sit start to a small right hand crimp to a wierd dyno. see video. May not be so bad and it may climb different when it's dry. great sloper!
content.location: If you walk west along the toe of the hill slope from "tok cutoff" for about 400' you will find this problem. I also climbed a few things on a boulder right above this on the hill. There is an obvious short finger crack called "finger breaker"

content.description: Another nice line on the Thirty 4 and 7 boulder! Start SDS, pull the lip and continue up the slab.   See video. myuctv.com/video?id=659
content.location: On the southwest side of the Thirty 4 and 7 boulder.

content.description: A nice warm-up route just north of Step Sister and South of Tok Cutoff. Approximately 100 feet from the Cavitation Boulder. Climbs the west, diamond shaped face.
content.location: Just north of Step Sister and South of Tok Cutoff. Approximately 100 feet from the Cavitation Boulder.

content.description: Just left of "tok cutoff" sit start on thin holds to a big sloper. see video
content.location: The boulder is northwest of Bear Rape boulder and North of the 30 4 years olds boulder, approximately 150 feet away from both. Just left of the birch tree, if memory serves, on the southeast backside of the boulder behind the Point Hope boulder.

content.description: A nice warm-up on the Cavitation Boulder.
content.location: On the west side of the Cavitation Boulder. In the same area as Bear Rape, Sweet Tooth, Tombstone etc.

content.description: Sit start the crack for left hand and prow for the right hand. Just left of "Sweet Tooth". See myuctv.com/video?id=659 for video beta.
A steep short sit start to a sloper top out. Felt stout for being so tiny.
content.location: On the downhill side of the "Point Hope" boulder. A steep little face with very thin holds. The boulder is northwest of Bear Rape boulder and North of the 30 4 years olds boulder, approximately 150 feet away from both.

content.description: Sit start under nice tall line of jugs. The first two moves are the headest. see video
content.location: Same boulder as "Point Hope". The boulder is northwest of Bear Rape boulder and North of the 30 4 years olds boulder, approximately 150 feet away from both.

content.description: A great line out of the Bear Rap cave. Start low on two edges and move up and right through a series of crimps and slopers to hit a right hand undercling and toss to the lip.
content.protection: Pads. The landing is uneven with rocks.
content.location: Just south east of the Cavitation boulder and The Tombstone Boulder. It is the obvious cave with a crack splitting the right side.

content.description: Sit start the middle of this 8'wide tombstone block on very very thin holds to a long reach to still thin holds......
content.location: Around back and right of "sweet tooth" is a grey tombstone like block about 10-11' high, 3' thick, and 8' wide. This problem is up the center of the east face.

content.description:
Same sit as 30 4 year olds but go straight up through thin face moves. Thin and tricky.  Detailed description:   A thin funky sit start on super good rock. Start crouching, not SDS on holds to the left and right of the down-facing subtle triangle seam, right above the lip, above the really steep section... Left hand under seam, right hand crimp. move right to slopeing edge and then move straight up the slab/vertical face, utilizing the seem and face holds. See video for beta. 

myuctv.com/video?id=659  There is a SDS project to this problem and 30 Seven Year olds, that starts at the lowest possible holds(slopers on the low rib feature), which then moves through the start and finishes the route. Speculated to be V10. So, both routes have project starts.

A thin funky sit start into right trending holds to a nice big move for the lip. Super good rock. Start crouching, not SDS on holds to the left and right of the down-facing subtle triangle seam, right above the lip, above the really steep section... Left hand under seam, right hand crimp. move right to slopeing edge and then trend right into center of overhang...finishes with dyno to the lip. See video for beta. 

myuctv.com/video?id=659  There is a SDS project to this problem and 30 Seven Year olds, that starts at the lowest possible holds(slopers on the low rib feature), which then moves through the start and finishes the route. Speculated to be V10.
content.location: This boulder is really great and has quite a few good lines. If you stay on the south edge of the flat zone keeping the road to your left you should come right to this boulder and from here it will be easy to find everything else. About ten minutes from car.

content.description: Nice granite boulders up above Long Lake less than a mile before Wiener lake. Close to road and not too noisy. I put up roughly 35 problems here but there was much I did not have the time to get to.    There seems to be a good concentration of moderate to difficult problems so enjoy.
